title: Graph of magnetic field from center of wire

content.question: A long wire of radius R carries a current I, as shown above, with a current density J = ar that increases linearly with the distance r from the center of the wire. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnitude of the magnetic field B as a function r ?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice A has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice A has a curve plotted that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin as a horizontal line and continues horizontally until reaching R, when it becomes decreasing and concave up.

Choice B is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice B has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice B has a curve plotted that starts at the origin as a linearly increasing line and continues until reaching R, when it becomes decreasing and concave up.

Choice C is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice B has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice C has a curve plotted that starts at the origin as an increasing concave up curve and continues until reaching R, when it becomes decreasing and concave up.

Choice D is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice D has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice D has a curve plotted that starts at the origin as a horizontal line and continues horizontally until reaching R, when it jumps to a point on the dashed vertical line above the origin and becomes decreasing and concave up.

Choice E is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice E has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice E has a curve plotted that starts at the origin as a linearly increasing line and continues until reaching R, when it jumps to the horizontal axis and becomes a horizontal line along the axis.

content.answer: Choice C is a graph with B on the vertical axis and lowercase r on the horizontal axis. Choice B has a value uppercase R labeled about halfway across the horizontal axis, and a vertical dashed line at uppercase R going up from the axis to the plotted curve. Choice C has a curve plotted that starts at the origin as an increasing concave up curve and continues until reaching R, when it becomes decreasing and concave up.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
